Многие из нас обожают хорошие детективы, будь то сериалы, фильмы, книги либо игры. 40489135.review:
[h1]《The Deed(恶果)》[/h1]

刚刚第三周目(如果可以算周目的话)以女佣被捕作为第一次通关结局。先来写下此刻的想法吧。
第一次玩什么都不懂，整栋别墅四处转了转，简单检查了一下物品，了解了一下背景，最后是拿走了刺剑和老鼠药，选择刺剑杀了妹妹，刚走出画室就被发现。
第二次开始根据已发现的物品思考如何安排谋杀，发现了女佣屋里的玻璃碎片和画室的情诗有联系，于是确定谋杀计划，但是因为在之前的对话中没有注意自己的语气，导致自己也被怀疑，最终女佣脱罪我被捕。
第三次小心选择每一条对话，最终警官完全没有怀疑到自己，女佣被捕。
我本来在前两次还在绞尽脑汁思考怎么才能谋杀成功不被怀疑，然而当我看到女佣被冠上“女佣杀手”的那刻，我心里却有一点点的不舒服。
纵使从小的成长环境给了主角足够的杀人动机，但是最终还是让一个外人来承担了罪名。而主角虽然继承了家产，也惶惶不可终日。严厉的父亲的打骂，疯癫的妹妹杀了自己的宠物朋友，主角到底该不该选择杀了她呢。
都说公道自在人心，人心又在哪里呢。
果然种下恶果的那一刻，就再也没有HAPPY ENDING。

40448529.review:
Um jogo pequeno feito em RPG Maker (ou algum programa similar), porém muito criativo. O jogo não se localiza temporalmente, mas tem um clima que lembra filmes como A Dama de Preto ou Os Outros, podendo se passar no final do Sec XIX ou início do Sec  XX. Um clima sombrio que se passa em uma noite chuvosa. O jogo ainda possui um design bem caprichado, com personagens bem feitos sem o aspecto chibi/caricato tendo proporções realistas.
A principio, achei que se tratava de resolver um caso de assassinato dentro de sua família, mas na verdade, é exatamente o contrário, você tem que matar a sua irmã sem deixar pistas, fazendo um crime perfeito.
A família do protagonista é asquerosa, do tipo que judia de seus criados, somente o protagonista tem um lado mais humano (pelo menos até cometer o crime).
O jogo tem um roteiro bem interessante, porem é curto. Se zera em questão de 20 min. Tem uma certa dificuldade da primeira vez, mas jogando de novo, você já sabe exatamente o que fazer.
É um game indie interessante e que está barato na Steam. R$1,00 em promoção.

40302665.review:
声明

评测发布于STCN：https://steamcn.com/
STCN鉴赏家：http://store.steampowered.com/curator/255962/
完整图文评测：https://steamcn.com/t364025-1-1





優缺點彙總

加分項

+ 有创意的扮演凶手的玩法
+ 对话线索环环相扣
+ 不同场景的不同选项
+ 不错的氛围营造



扣分項

- 为体验其他结局需多周目，重复性高
- 过短的游戏流程





       《The deed (恶果)》是推理游戏中的另类——玩家将扮演凶手，通过对话诱导和伪证安放，想办法把罪名嫁祸给其他人来逃脱罪责。在类似密室的庄园之中，每个角色都有着自己的一段故事，以及自己的潜在动机。这种手法让人仿佛看到了阿加莎·克里斯蒂的著作《无人生还》的剧本影子。不同于小说和电影，在游戏中，玩家只得自己去挖掘这些动机，并利用他们，帮助自己成功犯罪。嫁祸方案制定的成功与否，也取决于对话中所探出的有关人物的信息。这种玩法相当有创意。

       除此之外，这款游戏采用了恐怖RpgMaker游戏的手法来营造出了一种阴森抑郁的氛围，和游戏主题相当吻合。

       但是，作为一款多结局游戏，甚至每个结局对应一个成就，多周目几乎是必不可少的选项。在多周目中，很多剧情内容大同小异，而又因为之前的场景选择，将对后续的场景产生深远影响，这就使得有些时候游戏的存档成为了摆设。玩家将不得不面对重复性较高的游戏内容。

       而游戏流程实在过短，可以说只用了一个小时，讲了一个小品级的小故事，很容易给玩家带来意犹未尽之感。但反过来说，面对这么短的游戏流程，玩一下也不浪费时间。反正都已经绿了，为何不尝试以下这个佳作呢？


遊戲短評

       《The deed (恶果)》是一款披着RpgMaker外衣的文字推理游戏。但是有别于其他的推理游戏，在《The deed (恶果)》中，玩家扮演的是凶手。这种设定非常的新颖。这位凶手与家庭关系并不和睦，但是却是这一贵族家庭的唯一合法继承人，不过当他听说父亲要将财产送给自己的妹妹后，他便动起了杀心。因此，玩家可以说是充满了作案的动机，若是犯案，恐怕很难逃过法律的追责，那么如何在行凶中逃脱罪行，甚至嫁祸给其他人呢？这款游戏就此便提供了很多的选择。

       《The deed (恶果)》对氛围的营造也十分到位，给玩家带来了无穷的负能量（因此，肯定是不推荐已经在负能量的心态下还进行这款游戏的游玩，避免雪上加霜）。阴暗的色调，诡异的背景音乐，癫狂的对话内容都在暗示着这款游戏的阴郁。

       而在类似密室的庄园之中，每个角色都有着自己的一段故事，以及自己的隐藏在表面下的潜在杀人动机，这种手法让人仿佛看到了阿加莎·克里斯蒂的著作《无人生还》的剧本影子。不同于小说和电影，在游戏中，玩家只得自己去挖掘这些动机，并利用这些信息，帮助自己成功逃脱罪责。

       《The deed (恶果)》的故事是非常精彩的，只是可惜，流程实在太短。可能十几分钟就能完成一个周目的游戏内容。但是，既然是喜+1，而且仅需花半个小时就能有着非常愉悦的游戏体验的话，那何乐而不为呢？

40286018.review:
[b][u]5 Things You Should Know about [i]The Deed[/i][/u][/b]

[b]What's Is It?[/b]
A short RPGMaker adventure game about a guy trying to get away with murder.  A single play-through takes maybe 10-15 minutes (faster once you know what you're doing.)  The plot is simplistic and to the point, but the amount of player agency is remarkably complex, all things considered.  Overall, fun for what it is.

[b]What's The Best Part?[/b]
The game has a surprising variety of choices, considering how short it is.  You can plant fake evidence to throw off pursuit and choose from a number of murder weapons.  All in all, you really get the feeling that you're [i]deciding how to proceed[/i] for yourself, rather than simply solving a puzzle in a game.

I was caught the first time I played it through because I made the classic mistake - I forgot to fully think through what would happen [i]after[/i] I did the deed!  This is where the game shows it's true brilliance; it's not just about killing your target and then escaping the scene.  You also need to get through the police investigation which follows, and that part is surprisingly thorough, so without proper forethought, you'll probably end up getting caught.

[b]What's The Worst Part?[/b]
The graphics are pretty bad, honestly, but considering how short the game is, I didn't mind too much.

[b]Will I Like It?[/b]
As far as RPGMaker games go, I'd say this is one of the better ones I've played (not that I'm an expert on RPGMaker games or anything.)  It makes you think in unorthodox ways, but it doesn't overstay its welcome.  As such, although its flaws are fairly apparent, they don't get on your nerves because the game is so short.

[b]Why Should I Buy It?[/b]
Well, for starters it's less than $1.  Given the replayability factor, it's well worth the price.

39943985.review:
Sinopsis.

Interpretamos a Arran Bruce heredero de la familia Bruce el cual descubre que su padre intenta desheredarlo y darle la fortuna a la hermana menor de Arran.
Nuestro protagonista se encuentra en conflicto con su familia por acontecimientos sucedidos en su infancia.

El juego es muy barato y realmente es aceptable considerando lo que nos ofrece el juego. El juego podría tomarse como un libro corto, una historia simple pero que no deja de ser interesante. Este realmente se puede disfrutar únicamente en la primera partida.

Historia.

Puede llegar a ser entretenida aunque pega bastante con chiclés de historias de asesinos. El juego nos da la libertad de conocer los trasfondos interactuando con el entorno y con todos los personajes. Es muy corta, pero sencilla y cómoda.

OST.

La música del juego se siente bien colocada, te hace sentirte cómodo jugando, como si de una película se tratara. A pesar de tener muchos sonidos por defecto no sientes que sea un trabajo mal hecho.

Duración.

El juego puede ser terminado en su primera partida en menos de 40 minutos, esto realmente llega a ser un poco molesto, aunque se podría usar el pretexto de que estamos jugando una "versión de prueba" ya que existe un juego más completo pero con diferente historia.

39757945.review:
I wasn't sure what to expect when playing The Deed. The game play is pretty simple, but the game isn't about all of the graphics and effects, it's more about 'getting away with murder'. You are confronted with a scenario where you are expected to commit a murder. The strategy of the game is all about picking up the right combination of items, and paying attention to details along the way. By the end of the game, I was clenching my fists in anticipation as I awaited the final verdict. Was I going to be found guilty? Or would I actually get away with murder? 

Overall, I think The Deed is an outstanding idea for a game. I didn't get away with murder the first time, but I can always try again.

有趣的创意和较高的游戏性让我选择买入这款游戏，事实上的确比我想的还有有趣。先吐个槽，也许是我胆子小，但这音效真的有几分恐怖游戏的格调，主角第一次回忆的时候让人防不胜防，那时候屏幕逐渐变成血色，我还以为会有鬼什么的，吓到退出游戏。夸夸优点，The Deed这款游戏麻雀虽小，却五脏俱全，凶器和证物一样只能拿一个，还要选择安置物品的地点。这就需要依靠玩家的智慧和脑补能力（还有“经验“）思考如何把两样物品链接在一起，用来编造一个令人信服的杀人故事。杀完人之后也别放松，警察来了审问你的时候，会询问你做过的事，说过的话，去过的地方等细节，详细到让你后悔之前做过的小动作，这时候应付询问，就需要你转移杀人嫌疑，暗示警察并甩锅，是否要选择撒谎，用你的犯罪心理来协助你战胜这场心理战，完成你脑海中的完美犯罪。

Have you waited for the right moment? Remember, there is no going back once the deed is committed and you will feel guilty for the rest of your life.

But is it really worth it, you ask yourself.

I am presented with a dark and urban atmospheric scene thats takes place inside a home that anyone will know will kind of give you the creeps. It is executed fairy well by providing you with a straightforward yet simple task. But your decisions must be chosen wisely while trying not to act sinister or sound too obvious. There are a vast array of weapons at your disposal in the house where it is possible you can frame anyone you want provided you also had taken some of their belongings to plant them as evidence then committing the impossible. You don't have much time, carry out your duty and hope you do not get caught.

Don't forget, it's your father's birthday. Behave and enjoy your supper.

A short and well played game. Time to learn the family's history.

10/10

37831248.review:
Jos olet koskaan pelannut Cluedoa, niin tämä peli tuntuu oitis tutulta, paitsi että et yritä selvittää rikosta, vaan tehdä rikoksen.
Pelihahmon on Arran Bruce joka saa tietää että hänen isänsä aikoo jättää hänet perinnöttömäksi ja testamentata kaiken hänen siskolleen Jenniferille. Arran päättäkin isänsä 50-vuotis syntymäivänä palata kotiin, mielessään vain yksi aikomus, tappaa sisarensa.
Peli on RPGMaker peliksi poikkeuksellisen hienon näköinen ja syvällinen. Ulkoasu on hieno ja tarinaan on saatu hienosti sisältöä ja syvyyttä. Ei mitään sir Arthur Conan Doylea, mutta hienosti kirjoitettu tarina.

Deed keskittyy pääasiassa itse tekoon, murhaan.
Murhan suorittamisessa tärkeää on pari asiaa. Millä tavalla murhan tekee? Käyttääkö veistä vaiko paljaita käsiä. Entä kenen syyksi aikoo murhan langettaa? Olisiko julma isäpappa oikea ratkaisu, vaiko uusi seksikäs sisäkkö, vaiko vanha uskollinen hovimestari. Vaihtoehtoja on muuta, murha-aseita on runsaasti ja mahdollisia lopetuksia on useita. Deed ei ole pitkä peli. Ensin siinä luodaan kuva pelihahmosta keskustelujen muodossa. Vaihtoehtoja on vajaa kourallinen, mutta niidenkin avulla peliin saadaan varsin hyvin vaihtelua. 
Kun pelaaja on valinnut murha-aseen ja todisteen jota käyttää tukemaan kehittämäänsä teoriaa siirrytään pelin parhaaseen puoleen, poliisitutkintaan. Pelihahmo joutuu nopeasti vastaamaan kyselyyn jossa ylikomisario tutkii tapausta. Riippuen pelaajan sanomisista ja tekemisistä, hänen saattaa selvitä murhasta, tai jäädä kiinni.

Teko, on pelinä hyvin nopeasti läpi pelattu, mutta se ensimmäinen pelikerta on se paras, kun kaikki tulee uutena. Pelissä saa aika vapaasti liikkua ympäriinsä ennen illallista jolloin keskusteluilla ja paikkojen katselemisella saa kuvan siitä, millaisesta perheestä on kyse. Sitten tulee vain kehittää oma idea siitä, miten kaikki ”oikeasti” tapahtuu, eli miten rikostutkinta sitten etenee. Ensimmäisellä pelikerralla kaikki on uutta joten tilanteisiin pitää reagoida kun ne tulevat vastaan. Uusilla pelikerroilla voi sitten kokeilla jotain muuta, kun tietää mitä tulema pitää, niin siihen voi varautua.
Vaikka pelin pelaa läpi viidessätoista minuutissa ensimmäisellä kerralla ja vähemmässä ajassa myöhemmillä pelikerroilla, niin se on hintansa arvoinen. Alle euron peliltä nyt ei voi kovin paljoa odottaa, mutta Deed tarjoaa todella hyvin pelattavaa.

Deed on tyylikäs ajattelupeli. Ensimmäisellä kerralla (Blind) se on tarkkaa miettimistä siinä mitä tekee ja mitä sanoo, samalla kun miettii tarkoin että miten suorittaisi murhan. Myöhemmillä kerroilla se on saavutusten metsästystä, kun yrittää suorittaa murhan siten, että se menee tietyn henkilön piikkiin. Ensimmäisellä omalla pelikerrallani onnistuin suorittamaan murhan niin, että se luokiteltiin itsemurhaksi.

+ Yksinkertainen mutta toimiva asetelema
+ Syvällisyys (vaihtoehdoissa, taustatarinassa…)

- Lyhyt
- Ei ääninäyttelyä

Arvosana: 7,5/10

37005095.review:
Allez, une petite review à chaud !

J'ai attendu que ce jeu soit soldé pour l'acheter (à moins de 50cts, c'était donné) car même si le concept avait l'air sympa, les graphismes ne m'inspiraient pas trop. C'est vrai que c'est très old school et pixellisé, les personnages ne sont pas très beaux ni détaillés, mais les artworks des persos quand ils parlent sont plutôt jolis et bien faits, et c'est l'essentiel dans ce type de jeu. Les décors ne sont pas trop brouillons et les interractions sont clairement indiquées.

Le jeu est court, mais raisonnable pour ce prix. Mon premier run m'a pris une petite 15aine de minutes en ayant parlé à tous les personnages et fouillé tous les objets de la maison, mais le principe de ce jeu est la répétition de l'aventure jusqu'à avoir le résultat parfait. En tout j'y ai passé environ 2h (une grosse poignée de tentatives) pour réussir à remplir l'objectif (faire accuser une personne, puis l'autre, jusqu'à un résultat satisfaisant).

Vous incarnez un homme qui retourne dans son ancienne maison de famille pour les 50ans de son père, tout au long de l'exploration de la maison on apprend le passé chaotique de la famille, c'est assez immersif, l'ambiance est là et l'aspect psychologique des personnages est plutôt bien exploité. L'introduction annonce la couleur directement : vous êtes là pour assassiner votre soeur, car votre père a décidé de vous rayer de son testament.

Le principe est vraiment très sympa et original, il se passe en 3 phases. Avant le repas, vous devez collecter dans la maison une arme et un indice, qui vous permettront de tuer votre soeur tout en faisant accuser quelqu'un d'autre (ainsi que parler aux différents personnages, vos réponses influeront sur les suspicions du commissaire). Après le repas, vous cachez l'indice dans une des pièces (ou pas) et assassinez votre soeur (à mains nues ou avec l'arme choisie). Lorsque le crime est découvert commence la troisième phase, l'interrogatoire, où vous devrez répondre de vos choix de dialogues et d'actions de la première phase, afin d'orienter l'investigation.

Une cinématique vous indique l'issue du jeu (qui a été accusé), et le run se termine et vous renvoie au menu principal. 

Le but ici est de recommencer over and over jusqu'à avoir réussi à faire accuser les personnes que vous vouliez faire accuser. Je n'ai pas trouvé ça très rébarbatif parce que ça s'enchaîne bien et de manière plutôt fluide, vous n'êtes pas obligés de reparler à chaque personnage ou revisiter chaque pièce à chacun de vos runs, et si vous le faites vous pouvez passer rapidement les dialogues en cliquant, les cinématiques et flash backs sont courts (on peut passer l'intro) et on arrive très rapidement à finir une tentative en quelques minutes à peine pour pouvoir tester toutes les possibilités (et au passage débloquer tous les succès Steam).

J'ai bien aimé l'ambiance et le côté réflexion (se creuser les méninges pour savoir quels objets utiliser et quelles réponses donner), à petit prix je recommande volontiers.

In the board game "Clue," you have to figure out who did it, in which room, and with which weapon.  In "The Deed," you're put into the role of the murderer; your task is to kill your victim and, ideally, pin it on someone else, using items you can find in the house as "evidence."

It's a short game with simple controls, but the multiple options for going about "The Deed" and the different achivements allow for good replay value.

In short, buy the game.  It's cheap, it's fun, and you get to play the bad guy!

It's like a game of Clue, but you are the killer! You need to find the right combinations of murder weapon and evidence to plant before you commit the murder so that you'll be found innocent when the detective shows up. 

Your interactions with the residents and the items you carry with you will determine whether you were successful in your deed or not. You can go around the manor and talk to everybody and/or examine items. Each playtime takes around 10 minutes to complete and I found it very fun to find the different combinations in order to accuse the other family members. 

I saw just about everything there is to see in the game after 2 hours, so once you figure out the right combinations there's barely any reason to go back. However, I had a lot of fun with it and I'd say it's definitely worth a playthrough if you're a fan of Clue.

An interesting little short game, if you can move past the cheap presentation. It's a thing of its own. Basically it's a short segment where you try to commit a murder and try to get away with it. The cop will then consider everything you did on the run. There's no other story or gameplay.

36350190.review:
I managed to finish the game a few times, get a few different endings, and I liked what I saw. The very premise is rare and very interesting, and the ideas of the game are presented in a way that's both clear and compelling.

This is a good game, especially considering its price. Good, but not exceptional.

What I did like about it is the writing, the simple premise, the exploration that warrants more than one playthrough. The game is atmospheric for such a little exercise in planning, and thinking through your execution. The endings are a genuine joy to read, as they vary enough to warrant repeated playthroughs.

On the other hand... I am a little disappointed by the lack of depth of how the game determines the outcome. In the end, the game follows a simple logic of "if you say A, or plant evidence B, or do C during dinner, then X, Y or Z will happen". It's not possible, as far as I've been able to determine, to plant convoluted, Agatha Christie style evidence that suggests A found out about B and thus decided to do C, or that one person framed another for murder. The game is too straightforward for this.

On top of that, while the game allow for some interesting dialogue options if you keep objects on your person, it's not possible to plant weapons (which is understandable) or two pieces of evidence (which is not). I know that with a more complex system the number of possible combinations to plan for, on the game design side, rises exponentially, but the mostly "one weapon, one piece of evidence" approach makes the game feel a bit artificial in its constraints.

And that's really a pity. A reverse murder mystery absolutely *should* have some convoluted endings and twists and turns and a lot of options to plant evidence in creative ways (what if you plant the mother's journal in the daughter's room, and a love letter from the daughter in the mother's room? Nope, you can't do that. The game doesn't allow it).

As it is, the game is entertaining enough and I do recommend it (especially as it's dirt-cheap), but it's a simple "plant evidence to cast suspicion on the corresponding person" exercise, which leaves me hungry for slightly more.

35876251.review:
An short morbid experience that turns out to be more interesting than I thought. You, als the prodigal son, return to the family estate to murder your sister and secure your inheritance.

It's a somewhat clunky and primitive pixel-art adventure game revolving around an awkward family dinner of 6 people with a lot of baggage. In the dialogue trees, in planting fake evidence and in choosing a murder weapon you have pretty good control over who will take the fall for your crime. And that's basically the game. Your first playthrough might last 25 minutes due to exploration and reading. At the end you'll probably rush through some options in just 3-5 minutes, so expect most of the content to lie in replays gunning for different endings or filling out achievements.

There is more depth to the game than I expected, with almost every action having some kind of impact during the final investigation of the death and with multiple degrees of suspicion towards every character. There has clearly been put some serious thought into the decision trees!

The game has a certain morbid charm and decent writing both in terms of characters and dialogue. Sound and music are apropriately atmospheric, but nothing to write home about. Apart from the reset (F12) not working, I had no technical issues with the game. There is content for about 2 hours of playtime, which is also pretty much when you'll be fed up with the game - so in a sense it has the perfect length. I think the (very low) price is pretty adequate for how much enjoyment you can get out of this game (especially considering sales, the bundle with the sequel and what you can recoup from trading cards). Check it out if it seems interesting to you, I definitely did not regret the purchase.

35396591.review:
It's...good.  It is!  For the price, it's definitely worth it.  You attempt to kill the sister that has made your life a living hell since childhood, and I'm not just talking stolen cookies, then frame literally anyone else in the house for it, my personal favorite being the dad, but...the murder was unjustified.  You're not playing a psychotic megalomaniac, you're playing a grown man who has finally made his way into the world, away from his abusive family (mother, father, and sister!), and is only coming back at this point because he heard he was being written out of his father's will in place of his mentally ill sister.  The motive, rather than revenge, which would make me feel somewhat satisfied, is greed.

Plotting murder is great fun, but motive is everything.  This wasn't as fun to me as it could've been.  My recommendation?  Get this for a buck, then get The Deed: Dynasty, or get them together as a package deal.  That has 3 Deed games in one, and all three have stronger motives than this snot-nosed brat, so it's infinitely more satisfying.  There's more options and trials, as well, making things more interesting.

35292411.review:
THE DEED(恶果)
  这个游戏总结起来就是一句话，作为凶手，实施犯罪后巧妙的栽赃陷害他人.阔能大多数人玩过作为侦探去判案的类似的冒险/RPG类的游戏，而这个游戏则恰恰相反，站在了凶手的角度去布控一次完美的犯罪.
  讲真，游戏的画质实在是不敢恭维，玩起来有种在玩一款很久远的游戏的感觉，这种感觉也在某种程度上契合了这款游戏的背景，故事发生在上世纪的英格兰（emmmmm具体我记不清哪一年了.......），游戏的主人公的父亲继承了家族的邓谢尔庄园，但主人公的父亲却是一个非常残暴的人，主人公的妹妹也患有精神上的疾病，主人公因为受不了父亲的残暴和妹妹的疯癫离家已经许多年，在父亲将要迎来五十岁生日的时候，父亲打算将家族产业传给妹妹，这让主人公感到非常的愤懑，于是计划以给父亲庆祝生日的名义回到庄园，施计将妹妹杀害，背景大概如此.
   游戏的流程也是比较短暂，大致上分为三个环节，寻找选择凶器，放置物证栽赃陷害，最后实施犯罪......游戏的凶器设置了很多的种类，有猎枪，长剑，毒药，麻绳等等等等（一个小小的注意事项，凶器的选择会影响你杀害妹妹后逃离现场的时间，猎枪时间最短，貌似是三秒，毒药的时间最长，貌似十多秒....）......物证呢主要是看你想要栽赃陷害的对象是谁，可以栽赃父亲，女仆，男管家，母亲等，此外游戏从开场的第一句对话开始，每一个对话都会对结果产生影响，也直接影响着你栽赃对象的的选择以及是否可以栽赃成功.
  游戏的价格也不贵，4元（打折的时候貌似只需要3元），物超所值，顺便还阔以成就全通关游戏+1.另外游戏自带中文（很良心，不需要头疼的去找什么汉化补丁下载....）emmmmmm....本人大学狗一枚，写的是在是稀松稀松，只不过这款游戏确实很值得去玩一玩，真的真的很棒很棒，推荐推荐

35174428.review:
Redrum. Redrum. REDЯUM!!!

The Deed со скидкой стоит 13 рублей. Продав карточки, вы получите где-то 15 при нынешних ценах торговой площадки. Проще говоря, вы ничего не теряете. Если же вы блюдёте расовую чистоту библиотеки, то с легким сердцем проходите мимо. Но если иногда вы решаете устроить марафон Поворотов не туда, вместо намеченного Крестного отца, или гордо съедаете чебурек у метро, в то время как дома вас ждет отменный ужин, то этот ребенок PRG мейкера - для вас. Всем иногда нужен отдых от солидных проектов и этот маленький симулятор бессердечного подонка - прекрасный выбор. 

ДЕЛО главного героя, заключается в том, чтобы устранить сестру на пути к наследству и не попасться на содеянном. Сестра - существо крайне неприятное, а дом, погода и атмосфера просто подталкивают к тому, чтобы забить кого-то подсвечником. Моральных терзаний по типу "тварь я дрожащая или право имею" замечено не будет, как говорил тов-щ Ганнибал: "Спасай себя, убей их всех". 

Внимательно изучив особняк, найдется широкий выбор бытовых предметов, которые впоследствии обагрятся кровью, и вещей, что послужат вашим алиби. Побеседовав со всеми присутствующими вырисуется четкий план на все дальнейшие прохождения. Можно даже попробовать выдать за самоубийство смерть от черенка швабры, почему бы и нет, сестра-то была явно не в себе. (Спойлер: следователь не идиот)

Игра разбита на несколько глав, таких как приезд, семейный обед, само "дело", и разговор с детективом. Прибыв в особняк, лица членов семьи показались мне странно знакомыми.. Точно! Я же видела их в 3D мультфильме о злоключениях кровосмесительной семьи, когда расширяла эротический кругозор. Это придало ситуации пикантности, пусть даже в этой конкретной семье за рамки дозволенного никто не выходил, кроме, пожалуй, протагониста.

Достижения отображают выбор орудия убийства и на кого были переведены стрелки. 100 процентов можно получить за пару-тройку часов, не прибегая к руководствам, все очень логично и относительно легко. 

P.S. Отравить сестру крысиным ядом, после того как она поступила с ручной крысой главного героя в детстве - почти поэтично.

我从来就没有太阳，所以不害怕失去。杀人者如是说道，敬请关注[strike] 东野奎吾之白[/strike]《今日说法》之恶果篇！

一款有趣的扮演谋杀者的小游戏。虽然整体的剧情和逻辑经不起严格的推理，但游戏本身与其对应的价格区间上的游戏相比还是卓尔不凡。官方现在自带中文，不过错别字和一些语序以及略微古怪的表达方式还是多少有些让人出戏。原来的英语文本并不复杂，简单大学英语即可轻松应对。游戏策略上比较简单轻松，相信每个人在多尝试几次之后便能很快完成全成就。

[spoiler]结局上，基本无论如何都没有完美结局，这暗合了游戏名《恶果》。想要杀人者逃脱惩戒？建议参考阿加莎.克里斯蒂的某个名篇。[/spoiler]

[spoiler] 评分：4/10[/spoiler]

其实主角完全没必要报复家庭不是么，报复完了还一直不肯离开这栋房子也是蛮扯的，把房子卖了远走高飞岂不美滋滋？不过按照主角这尿性估计还是活不安稳，所以没那个心理素质就别做什么杀人凶手嘛...又不是不报仇就活不下去，自己单干不好么，让这一家子疯去呗，没必要用家人的错误惩罚自己的人生。

不过妹妹，真的好讨厌啊，一直嘲笑男主，爸爸妈妈也偏爱妹妹（woc凭啥啊
如果是我估计也会很恨这个家的。

随便写写没啥干货，综上这游戏还是可以玩玩的，反正四块也不贵。bgm还有那个色调搞得我怕怕的（人比较怂），作案的时候我那个紧张的呀...（人怂嘛...而且人家很纯良的...）

34024458.review:
(TL;DR at bottom).

Note: the game is VERY short. The time I have spent on the game (a little less than 90 minutes) was enough to 100% it (read: get all achievements).

I got this game during the Summer Sale (I saw it at random and went "Hey, looks interesting!")

"The Deed" is a game about solving a murder. Except you're the murderer.
And you hate [spoiler]your sister[/spoiler].
So we're gonna commit [i]MURDER![/i]
Good for you!

As you start the game, you're given some backstory: you're heading back to your old home due to it being your father's birthday. Right as you enter, you're given the option to be a jerk ([spoiler]flirting with the maid[/spoiler]), be polite or come off as well... Off. 

Awesome.

Something I didn't know until my 5th playthrough (each playthrough took me about 5 min) was that you can press and hold the left Shift key to run faster (and fast forward all dialogue). It helps. Trust me. You move VERY slowly otherwise.
But as you're reading this, you know that now too! Good for you!

As you walk around the house and meet the people there, (your parents, your sister, the butler and the maid), you're given two objectives:
Find a weapon (note that some of them require you to keep your coat on - this causes some suspicion towards you, but it's perfectly possible to pass the game anyway) and a piece of evidence.
There's plenty of different kinds of weapons - ranging from [spoiler]your fists[/spoiler] to [spoiler]rat poison which is one of the two most poetic weapons in the game, the other being a mirror shard[/spoiler] you can use to commit the murder.

The second thing you need is "evidence". Obviously evidence meant to frame someone else in the household - be it the butler, the maid or [spoiler]even suicide OH MY[/spoiler].

Once you have obtained both items, a short dinner sequence is being held. During it, you can further add suspicion onto yourself or the one you intend to frame. 

After dinner, [spoiler]COMMIT MURDER DO IT DO IT DO DO IIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIT[/spoiler]. Oh, you're done? Cool!

Get the hell out.

Be warned: you have a timer depending on what kind of weapon you used. The timer ranges from 3 seconds (lots of noise) to 20 seconds (no noise). 

Once the body is found, you'll be interviewed. Tell the truth at all times - the investigator will say that your stories match up with the others in that case. 

If you pulled it off - congratulations, you got away with murder! ...But at what cost?

If you didn't, you're thrown in jail to rot away for the remainders of your days...



For the cheap price I paid for both this and The Deed: Dynasty (sequelish), I'd highly recommend it even at full price. 
There's plenty of replay value due to the different kinds of ways to commit murder, the indepth story and [spoiler]the damn scream at the end of the game is gonna haunt me until the day I die[/spoiler]!



TL;DR
If you're a fan of detective games (or want a nice twist to it) - I suggest you buy this game!
Press and hold Left Shift to move faster.

In my opinion, this is the [b]“I whole-heartedly despise my sister, and I shall bestow death upon her”[/b] game. But, it’s probably your typical murder mystery game.

The game’s pretty easy, all you have to do is to murder your sister without anyone finding out that you did it, and you have to frame someone else to be the prime suspect + make the person suffer in prison rather than yourself. A li'l bit cruel, isn’t it?

To be honest, I was hesitant at first if I should buy it or not. I even had to consult my best friend by asking him regarding the game, 'cause I’m quite curious ‘bout it. In the end, I still bought it. I’m really fond of Mystery & Thriller games, so this game really caught my attention.

I completed the game, including the achievements (of course, with a guide) in less than three hours and 30 minutes. I’m actually satisfied with the game, and I was having fun all throughout the gameplay.

The downside of the game for me is that whenever I press the F12 key, my whole game crashes. Nothing too much, but it's still bothering me.

Anyway, if you’re into Mystery & Thriller like me- I suggest buying this game, and let me tell you this; it’s really worth it + it's cheap and affordable.

33571788.review:
A quick one-two murder mystery game in which you try to murder your sister and try to plant evidence (or not) in order to keep the inevitable investigator off your tail. Very straightforward game that requires you to figure out different combinations at your own pace. You have a very limited amount of things which you can do, whether it be talking to a person, picking up fake evidence, or choosing a murder weapon. By the time dinner rolls around you have either set yourself up to fail or made yourself as unsuspicious as possible for when you do the deed.

By changing up who you speak to and what you say you are given different perspectives of the denizens of the house; trying to mix things up will give you a bit of a different perspective of the characters in the house and Arran's past, but everything becomes known to the player after five or six attempts at doing something vastly different each time.

For its price, it's a short game that can be played a few times over in order to get those achievements.

33469521.review:
[h1] The "I really hate my sister" game	[/h1]
I was more conflicted wether to give this a positive or a negative review than who I should blame for murder.

Your abusive father has decided to disinherit you from his Will in favour of your sister, whom you never forgave for eating your cookies. 
You return filled with greed and anger for a happy family reunion, planning to murder your sister while getting away with it and the heritance.  
Find a weapon, kill your sister, frame someone else and avoid suspicion.

[h1] Thumbs Up	[/h1]
A fun and alternative way of using RPGmaker. 

Lots of murder weapons, people to frame and every action have consequences. 
Every playthrough takes roughly 10 minutes. 

Low price - often on sale. 
Includes steam cards. 

You can skip the intro, which is great since you highly repeat the game going for achievements.

[h1] Thumbs Down [/h1]
A great concept, however even if it appears you have all the possibilities of combining any weapon, evidence and frame; you don't. 
The game is too fixed on a set of combinations to succeed, which applies to the achievements. Frustrating when you make combinations, that really should work. - Predetermined puzzle. 

The game is really repititve, even if it's so short. 
Getting them feels like a burden, unless you only play a few playthroughs once in a while. 

It seems you can only play in a very small window mode, in fullscreen the game doesn't expand, but just gets a dark border.

Easy to click the wrong dialogue choice, while clicking next in a conversation. It should be able to click outside the dialoque box in order not for this to happen. 

[h1] Closing Comments	[/h1]
When that's said: I enjoyed my first few playthroughs a lot. For the price this game exceeded my expectations by far.
Recommendable if you don't care much for the achievements and like me; torture myself by finishing over 2 days.

33403795.review:
游戏流程不长，一周目的时候把所有可以互动的内容都点了并仔细看了到结束不超过15分钟，内容流程大致为：

1、晚饭前收集栽赃证据和凶器（期间可以选择跟npc对话）
2、晚饭
3、晚饭后栽赃谋杀
4、警方调查拘捕

虽然警长断案不能算很严谨，但要想栽赃成功，并不是只靠栽赃的证据和凶器就够了，还要在之前与众人的对话里极力将话题内容和谈话气氛带向对要栽赃的对象不利的一面，增加其嫌疑，而且很多你以为无伤大雅的对话和行为选择都会被警长问到，徒增自身嫌疑。一周目玩了个自己被抓的结局体验很不错，就花了三个小时把所有的成就都打出来了，不过不管最后是哪一个结局，不管最后栽赃了凶手是谁，有没有继承到遗产，我们故事的男主人公都会在每天生活在恐慌、忧虑与空虚之中，所以说虽然是一个恶人主角的谋杀游戏，但是宣扬的价值观还是很正的？我一直想玩出来一个跟美丽的女仆幸福的生活在一起的结局，不过好像并没有T - T
 
优点：1、剧情丰满。虽然故事精短，不过通过各种对话和物品调查了解主角与家人之间的关系、家人与仆人的性格与秘密等等可以得出比较丰满的剧情。
          2、音乐贴合剧情。玩起来很有代入感。
          3、逻辑联系紧密。在谋杀前的每一个对话和选择，都会在最后审讯的环节中发挥意想不到效果。
缺点：1、有些地方还是欠交代，逻辑有些牵强。
           2、不能当一个好人！逼的善良的我要当一个坏人！
 
总得来说是一款非常值4块钱的游戏，可以一玩。

33136547.review:
一聽到與「謀殺」有關的遊戲，腦中所想的是如福爾摩斯、逆轉裁判那樣扮演偵探來辦案的遊戲；本作卻一反常態，讓玩家扮演兇手，以完美犯罪為目標，概念上不可不謂之創新。

本遊戲一輪的時間只要3～10分鐘，由於凶器有許多種、用以誤導調查的物品有許多種、可構陷的對象有許多位，因此可組合成許多不同的玩法，導入不同的結局。此外本作最令人耳目一新的便是與 NPC 的對話總有許多選擇可選。不僅會影響 NPC  的反應與對你的態度，還決定了你在接受偵探的問訊時，會遭遇到哪些詰問。

美中不足的是，本作的結局在「縱」的呈現不夠好。舉例來說，根據玩家在遊戲中的表現、選用的證物與凶器，偵探會對你意欲栽贓的對話抱有輕度、中度或高度的懷疑，但中度與高度懷疑的劇情是相同的，只在一、兩句對話有別。另外玩家能操弄的物品總共只有兩系，若能新增第三系（像是不在場證明），相信玩法會更加多元。

根據某些團體奇怪的邏輯，本作或許會被他們看做是鼓勵兇殺，但無論哪個結局都稱不上是「善終」，似乎是想呼應一個道理：一旦奪去誰的生命，自己往後的人生將再無寧日。警世意味十足。

I've played far more expensive games that didn't make me feel half of what this one does.  It's a reverse murder-mystery, where you are trying to murder someone (who richly deserves it) and frame someone else.  

The people who review and say "I tried all the combinations" is not likely telling the truth, because there are a lot more combinations than it at first appears.  (There are a number of places you can plant evidence---including to be deliberately found on your person.)

Memorable. Small. Makes you feel. I'd buy this guy's next one, if he made something similar.  It's small, but well-made.

32704547.review:
I picked this game up cheap, in a Humble Bundle or something. It's about $1 full price, and it goes on sale a lot. 

What is this game? It is a very simple murder simulator. You are a mean, nasty horrible person who heard his sister would be inheriting the family fortune, so you are coming to murder her. The game part of it comes in the fact that you can frame other people in the house for the murder, and you can choose other weapons. But you will murder your sister.

A play through takes about 8 minutes, which encourages you to choose different weapons, and dialogue options to try to frame other people. There are three endings [spoiler] (a) don't get caught, but do inherit, (b) don't get caught, but don't inherit, and (c) get caught. [/spoiler] There are achievements for each person you can frame, and each weapon you can use. You could achievement farm the game with a guide in just an hour or two, or you could spend awhile trying to figure it out all by yourself. 

The game is so short and so cheap , it is hard to be hate on the game. In fact, if you sell the card drops, it's probably less than $.50.  But there are very few likeable characters in the game (the butler and maid are ok, but otherwise every character is a terrible person), and I found it hard to care about the outcome. Really, I found achievement farming - how do I frame the maid so I get the achievement? Did that, now how do I frame the butler so I get the achievement? - to be the only reason to play the game.

32603556.review:
[h1] Who killed your sister?	[/h1]

You did.

The decision has been made but the choice is yours. What weapon to use? Who will you frame? Those are the obvious choices, but every little detail matters, every mundane conversation, and anything you say may be held against you.

The deed is a minimalistic reverse murder mistery, and quite frankly one of the most genius use I have seen made out of RPG maker.

A playthrough lasts about 10 minutes, but you probably won't succeed at first, and can get a lot more entertainment from unlocking all the endings. At the price tag of under a dollar, it's totally worth every penny.

The writing is good and the characters are amazingly well fleshed out for a short game.

[h1] Like a LA Noire interrogation, but in reverse	[/h1]

There aren't many games out there which let you play from this unique perspective, that of a suspected murderer trying to lie your way out of jail. 

...apart from the deed 2 of course, which uses the same formula but with more polish and more content. Both games offer a unique perspective and refreshing gameplay experience; you can get the bundle with your eyes closed.

很别致的小游戏，流程不长，目标明确的话五分钟就能完成一局，但仍然值得琢磨上一会儿。

关于成就部分额外补充几句：（内含剧透）

指南区有翻译好的全成就/结局指南（感谢翻译），但是实际操作起来似乎有点小小的不同……

游戏构成栽赃的条件应该是有证据和凶器能同时指向一个人，且主角自己没有惹事生非，并在规定时间逃离案发现场。

所以，也不知道是不是个人操作中还是有差池，指南的成就攻略里，[spoiler]把底裤丢进男仆房间，并用绳索谋杀[/spoiler]以达成无人被拘捕结局的方法，我并未成功。个人尝试可行的方式是让证据和凶器指向不同的人，这样能实现有两个嫌疑人，但证据都不足无法拘捕。

顺带一提， [spoiler]仆人对母亲焦虑的描述似乎也可以作为栽赃母亲的证据（禽兽啊禽兽）。[/spoiler]

最后，[spoiler]如果不想被定罪，那么务必让证据和凶器都能指向他人，试图造成无人有嫌疑的“大团圆”局面，最后会因为“被警方查出作案动机而拘捕”（有个动机就是我干的么？证据都没有就抓人还有没有王法了！(T＿T)）[/spoiler]

32213178.review:
A fun quick game to play.  The choices you make when conversing with the other characters affect the questioning you receive toward the end of the game.  
Your choice of item to plant and weapon to use also affect the game, from framing another to the possibility of suicide or getting caught yourself.  
Navigating around the house can be confusing at first.  I was not aware that the doors in a room below your character will open and he will step through them (going south) if you click on them.  Perhaps an arrow pointing downward above those doors would help first time players understand how to get into those rooms.
This game does have multiple endings.  It can be confusing which is the "right" ending.  I'm guessing there really is no "right" ending, just play the game and complete everything right to get the ending you're hoping for.  
I recommend this game if you're looking for something quick and simple to play.  You can always save your progress if you only have a few minutes to play this game at a time.

32063569.review:
The Deed is a short, dark, atmospheric point & click adventure, in which you're tasked with committing a murder.
Obviously, the goal is to do the dirty deed with the least significant consequences to yourself, meaning you're going to try to either frame someone else for the murder, or simply avoid getting blamed for it yourself (leaving it unsolved). While each single playthrough can be very short, the game does offer you different ways to achieve your goal, each with a different result, so the point is to have plenty of playthroughs, kind of like how it goes in Long Live The Queen, for example.

The gameplay itself is very simple. During the first couple of acts, your job would be to talk to people, trying to lead the conversations in the direction you want, while picking up two items out of the junk scattered around the house. One item should serve as a murder weapon, while the other's function is to be a false, planted evidence, meant to lead the police to suspect the victim you'd like to frame.

After doing the deed itself, you'll be interviewed by a police detective, having to answer questions perhaps explain your behavior. Again, just like during the previous phase, the idea is to lead the detective to the conclusion you're interested in. As soon as you're done, you're given the outcome of the game. Being consistent and logical, it's pretty easy to get to the result you want, but despite that fact, I've found the game to be entertaining enough, especially considering its low price.

Don't expect anything special regarding graphics or music, as the entire focus of the game is the plot. Also, I did experience the occasional crash, losing my progress, but since each playthrough is so short anyway, there's wasn't too much progress to lose to begin with.

All in all, this is a cute little mystery game, definitely worthy of its price tag, in my opinion.

31909928.review:
The Deed is not so much an RPG as a strategic adventure game. Your goal is to commit a murder and get away with it, and the gameplay involves exploring a house and interacting with people, leading up to committing the deed.

There are a half-dozen people to converse with, including your intended victim. Conversation is varied, includes multiple choices, and may go in any number of directions, all of which may have an affect on the outcome of your playthrough.

Exploring the house, you are allowed to pick up two items to be used later. One can be used as the murder weapon, and one may be planted as evidence against someone else in the house.

Once you have selected two items, dinner is served, during which you must choose whether to speak and how to respond to the various discussions around the table.

After dinner, you may again converse with people, and may choose from a number of places to stash your evidence. When you finally enter the room with your intended victim, you commit the murder, and have an amount of time, depending on the circumstances, to flee the scene before the death is discovered.

The investigator arrives, and questions you and everyone else present, and you must choose answers to his questions. At the end, the investigator announces his findings, giving some insight into how he came to his conclusions, and the ultimate decision of who he believes is the guilty party. A number of different endings are possible.

Everything you say and do, from the start of the game to the finish has the potential to affect the outcome of the game. You can strive to simply cover your own guilt, or you can aim to indict a specific person in the house. The game has enormous replayability.

The visuals, especially the character portraits, are very high quality, and the sheer diversity of the various scenarios make this a flawless game, and your enjoyment of it will depend solely on whether you are interested in this type of gaming experience. If you are, I highly recommend a purchase.

31442772.review:
凶手比侦探更难做，类似的是，扮演凶手的推理游戏比扮演侦探的推理游戏更难做。

本人接触过许多扮演侦探的推理游戏，如逆转裁判、枪弹辩驳、福尔摩斯系列、柯南系列、黑色洛城……这些游戏，就算在推理过程上可能赋予玩家一定的自由度，可惜流程终归是线性的，毕竟真相只有一个，案件告破后，游戏就没有再重复的价值了。（黑色洛城可能稍微特殊一点，这里不剧透）

The Deeds虽流程短小，无非是餐前准备，餐后作案，侦探推理三个阶段，一般十五分钟就可以完成一出案件，但游戏赋予玩家多样的作案手段，以及犯案之后和侦探斡旋的多种可能性：不同的凶器，不同的误导线索，不同的地点，不同的供词，会决定你是在劫难逃，成功栽赃，造成无头案还是达成玩美犯罪。尽管本作细节方面有些粗糙，侦探的某些结论太过想当然，然而整个游戏的灵性是无法否认的——何况这样的游戏太少了。

31225615.review:
This was a pretty unique game.  It's basically a murder mystery; only you are the murderer, and must create an alibi and plant incriminating evidence in order to get away with it.  There was a lot of fun in exerimenting throughout my different play-throughs: who will I pin this on?  How will I cover my tracks? Etc.  A single play-through can be done in about ten minutes, but all the different scenarios give it a nice replayability.
  While the characters seemed to go out of their way to be unlikable (including the "protaganist"), I think that was the point.  It makes it easier to frame one of them, or if you are caught, that game over screen doesn't feel so bad when you know that "our hero" deserved it.  The overtones of the game are very dark, and you know that no one will get out with a happy ending.  Even victory has a bitterness to it.
  I really only have two complaints, the first being that some of the dialogue choices would get pretty old after seeing them so many times.  Some characters only have a few ways to interact with them, and you figure out which ways are most benificial pretty fast.  My other complaint is in the sound department.  A variety of creepy ambient songs would go a long way, however, since this game is meant to be played multiple times, repetitive music would get old fast.
  If you see this game on sale, or you just want a dark new experience, give The Deed a try.  I haven't tried the sequal The Deed: Dynasty, but this game sets a high bar for it.

31212863.review:
不错的游戏，流程略短。游戏的主旨就是跟家里人感情很差的男主角为了得到家里的遗产，杀死精神有问题的姐妹（忘记是姐姐还是妹妹了，反正差不多），栽赃陷害别人来逃脱犯罪嫌疑。我是全英文玩的，很容易就能看懂。也不说什么四六级，我初中玩也可以猜到大致意思，凶器看不懂是什么的话百度一下就行。
游戏主要是三个流程。第一个阶段是跟家里人对话，寻找凶器和栽赃证据，找到武器*1，证据*1一共两样东西的话就可以开始晚餐了，要注意选择，找到武器*2就没有栽赃证据了（对话的时候要正常一点，不要愤世嫉俗和性骚扰，这会增大自己的嫌疑）。第二个阶段是在晚餐的时候发言，藏栽赃的证据以及杀人（杀人之后有个逃离的时间，尽量躲在别的房间。逃离时间的长短跟选择的武器有关，枪之类动静很大的凶器给的逃离时间很短。反正哪样都能杀人，按shift可以跑步，所以这个设定随意啦，我这种手残都可以逃出来，挺容易的）。第三个阶段是侦探询问阶段，被发现的话主角就要去坐牢了。要尽量诱导侦探怀疑别人，洗脱自己的嫌疑，尽量不要撒谎，因为你回家之后的一切行为侦探都可以从别人那里问到。（话说这侦探挺傻的，就一样证据就能定罪。不过要是柯南来了这游戏也没办法玩了）
按照攻略的话（社区里面有），全成就挺容易，但是没人背锅的结局我按攻略弄不出来，只好用了成就解锁器。
总而言之，这游戏还不错，杀人的时候配的bgm还真的让我紧张起来了。如果主角跟家里人的回忆杀再多一点就好了。现在的话还是有点短，加点剧情的话这个作品会更上一层楼的。
虽然杀人嫁祸很不好，但是我挺能理解主角的。我觉得他的家里人大部分都有病，教育孩子的方式极差，而且根本不疼主角。他们养出这种杀害亲人的主角是很正常的事情。养孩子养的不好，自己就要狗带，这真有教育意义啊。游戏结局剧透了没什么所谓，主角得到遗产后空虚的度过一生，挺常见而且合理的，要是Happy End我反而受不了。






















PS：竟然有百合情节~~~666

31178995.review:
[i]Если у вас нету тёти, то вам её не потерять. И если вы не живёте, то вам и не, то вам и не, то вам и не умирать![/i] (с)

Если вы играли в настольную игру Cluedo, то это, можно сказать, своеобразный пролог к ней. Только если в Cluedo нужно раскрыть преступление, то здесь его нужно совершить и отвести от себя все подозрения. Симулятор решения квартирного вопроса  без комплекса Раскольникова.

Итак, ситуация: вас в семье ненавидели всю вашу жизнь. Сестра называла крысёнышем и даже убивала вашего питомца-крысу. Отец регулярно бил. Мать обращала внимание только на сестру, но та при этом постоянно болела и доставляла всем одни проблемы. Отец оставил вас без наследства - а оно весьма себе солидное... 

И вот, в день рождения своего отца, вы возвращаетесь в родное гнездо на званый ужин. Не то что бы вас хотели там видеть, но и выпроводить не могут: надо держать лицо на людях.

Что ж, пора! Действующие лица: вы, нелюбимый сын - главный герой. Сестра. Мать. Отец. Дворецкий. Новая служанка. 

Игра поделена на несколько частей: прибытие и разговор с членами семьи + поиск орудий убийства и улик; обед; совершение убийства и побег; интервью со следователем. Проходится быстро: за полчаса можно управиться с первым прохождением.

Вариантов уйма. Можете обставить всё как классическое убийство без убийцы. Или раскопать стихи вашей сестры к новой служанке и подставить всё как самоубийство по причине слабого здоровья и неразделенной любви. Или использовать дурной характер отца и застрелить сестру из дробовика, скинув вину на главу семейства. Или найти дневник матери, где она, устав от болезней вашей сестры, даже пишет, что, мол, лучше бы та вообще не рождалась. Или подставьте дворецкого со служанкой...

Конечно, игра не будет пропагандировать идею "нет человека - нет проблемы". Чтобы никто не подумал, что такая семья заслуживает подобной участи, и можно в отместку за унижения прожить счастливую взрослую жизнь в годном особняке с внушительными запасами денег... и слышать предсмертные крики сестры по ночам, по канону жанра.

Но если быть честным, некоторым преступлениям лучше так и остаться нераскрытыми.

   The Deed is a short Rpg game. You are the son of a rich man, but you left your family because they are all either psycopaths or wannabe serial killers. The game is pretty simple. 1. Talk to everyone in the house. 2. Grab some evidence. 3. Grab a weapon. 4. Go to dinner. 5. plant the evidence. 6. Murder your sister. It's kind of monotonous after you play for a while, but it is relatively easy to get all of the achievements. Overall, use a coupon to buy and card farm it. I'll give it a solid 5/10 for the cards and achievements.

30077826.review:
Jeżeli ta recenzja miałaby być tak mała, jak cena The Deed to napisałbym: kupuj!

"Czyn" nie kosztuje bowiem nawet 4 zł. Jego przejście nie wymaga, zbyt dużo czasu. Na dobrą sprawę, jakiekolwiek zakończenie można zobaczyć już po około 30 minutach gry. Mimo to - i tak warto.

The Deed opowiada historię wydziedziczonego Arrana Bruce'a. Jego ojciec obchodzi okrągłe urodziny, cały majątek został przepisany na, nie do końca normalną, siostrę Arrana. W związku z tym, młodzieniec postanawia wrócić do domu po latach nieobecności i poukładać rzeczy tak jak powinny wyglądać. Czyli pozbyć się siostry. I najlepiej zrzucić winę na kogoś innego.

I na tym polega cała zabawa. Nie jest sztuką zabić siostrę. Zawsze się ją zabija - jednak całym clou tytułu jest zabić ją tak, by aresztowany został inny z domowników. Który? To zależy tylko od tego, jak zostaną podłożone dowody i czym zostanie zabita dziedziczka. Przykładowo: tylko lokaj ma klucze do szafki, w której schowana jest lina. Akurat zapomniał jej zamknąć... Co najlepsze: niekoniecznie musi zostać w tym przypadku uznany winnym (!) - przecież młoda dama mogła popełnić samobójstwo. Sposobów jest cała masa. Dodatkowo, olbrzymią rolę odgrywają same dialogi. Jeżeli przy obiedzie powiesz, że lokaj zagląda w dekolt panią przy stole, wtedy detektyw doda do siebie wszystkie fakty a wynik będzie taki, jaki chcemy. Proste. 2+2=5. Bo możemy. Naprawdę fajnie zaczyna być, gdy chce się wrobić kogoś konkretnego. Bo wbrew pozorom - to wcale nie jest takie łatwe.

Podsumowując: "The Deed" stworzone jest do tego, by próbować różnych wariantów i szukać różnych zakończeń. Jak na niecałe 4 zł. Świetna zabawa - nawet pomimo tragicznej grafiki (sekret: w pewnym momencie przestaje mieć ona jakiekolwiek znaczenie).

29799985.review:
Vaše rodina vás nesnáší, vysmívá se vám, ale jelikož se blíží narozeniny vašeho otce, rozhodnete se přijet do vašeho panství. Kromě toho máte ale postranní úmysly - zabít vaši sestru, jedinou dědičku nezměrného bohatství a vše tak získat pro sebe. Otázkou ale je, jak tohle provést a na koho svalit vinu...

[h1]Hraní za záporáka... tak nějak[/h1]
Člověk nemusí být extrémně inteligentní, aby mu došlo, že tu hrajete za zápornou postavu. Podobně jako třeba u Luciuse i zde zabijete nevinného člověka a snažíte se narafičit důkazy tak, aby si detektiv myslel, že onen ohavný čin spáchal někdo jiný. Autor se s tím ale nemazlil a musím říct, že většina postav se k vám chová jako k odpadu, častuje vás urážkami a hnusnými přezdívkami a neustále se vás snaží před všemi shodit. Díky tomu je o něco lehčí provést celý akt a poté to hodit na někoho, kdo se vám příčí.

Na začátku hry je tedy hezky vysvětleno, co se děje a proč. Přijedete na panství a zábava začíná.

[h1]Prohlídka domu[/h1]
První fází hry je prohlídka domu, případné rozmluvy s členy rodiny či služebnictvem a poté to nejdůležitější - nalezení dvou předmětů. Rozhovory s postavami jsou do jisté míry důležité, protože v pozdější fázi hry díky tomu můžete nasměrovat detektiva na špatnou stopu a on nechá pykat za vraždu nevinného. Vaše postava u sebe může mít pouze jednu věc označenou jako vražednou zbraň a jednu věc označenou jako důkaz. Musíte tedy pečlivě zvážit, co použijete. Výběr zbraně není zas tak důležitý, ale pokud vyberete hlučnější nebo pomalejší, dostanete na útěk o mnoho méně času a někdo vás může spatřit.

Oproti tomu výběr důkazu je důležitý. Musíte si předem rozmyslet, na koho se budete snažit vraždu hodit a dle toho zvolit i správný předmět. Kombinací zbraní a předmětů je tu celkem dost, bohužel to nemá mnohdy zas tak velký vliv na konec hry. Po sebrání dvou věcí se ozve zazvonění a vy se vydáte na večeři.

[h1]Trocha klábosení a vražda[/h1]
U večeře budete svědky hádky, do které se samozřejmě zapojíte. Nachází se zde také pár důležitých voleb, které ovlivní pozdější fázi hry. Po večeři je čas na vykonání vraždy. Nejprve je nutné vzít důkaz a umístit ho do místnosti osoby, na kterou chcete tohle všechno hodit. Pak se vydáte do místnosti, kde je vaše sestra a sprovodíte ji ze světa. Ihned poté se vám začne odpočítávat časomíra a během této doby musíte utéct někam do místnosti, kde jsou nejlépe nějací jiní lidé, kteří vám poskytnou alibi.

No a nakonec nás čeká závěrečná fáze hry, kdy na scénu přichází detektiv. Ten vás vyslechne a musíte si dávat pozor, abyste na vše odpověděli pravdivě. Můžete v rozhovorech poukázat na fakt, že některý z členů rodiny nebo služebnictva má určité potíže a tím nasměrovat detektiva na nějakou osobu. Pokud jste vše udělali správně, máte vyhráno. Pokud ne, inu, očekávejte zasloužený trest smrti.

[h1]Vražda k večeři[/h1]
A to je vše. Dohrání hry vám zabere maximálně kolem deseti minut. Klíčem k úspěchu tu je ale právě znovuhratelnost. Co takhle zkusit vzít jiné předměty, mluvit s jinými lidmi a pak to hodit na někoho jiného? Kombinací je tu spousta, bohužel jen některé vám nakonec vyjdou. Kromě vraždy je možné i mít zločin neobjasněný nebo to celé uzavřít jako sebevraždu. Rozhovory s detektivem jsou celkem promakané, jelikož stačí jedna malá lež a už stín podezření leží na vás.

Bohužel mi hra přišla jako takový lehký nadprůměr, za což může i grafické zpracování. Jelikož je tohle vytvořeno programem RPG Maker, nelze čekat zázraky. Paleta barev je taky výrazně omezena a hudba je průměrná. Nápad to je opravdu hodně zajímavý, ale provedení je takové nijaké. Někoho tohle bude bavit a zjišťovat kombinace, které fungují, je zábava. Jenže hrát to několikrát po sobě? Nemyslím si, že by to moc lidí bavilo, zvlášť když vezmu v potaz vcelku omezené dialogy. Jenže když se podívám na cenu, je jasné, že by byla škoda tohle zajímavé dílko nedoporučit.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ zajímavý nápad
+ jednoduchá hratelnost
+ temná atmosféra
+ znovuhratelnost
+ cena

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- hra je velmi krátká
- do jisté míry je hra i velmi omezená a paradoxně se po čase může dostavit stereotyp
- podprůměrné audiovizuální zpracování

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 5,5/10[/b]

The Deed je zajímavým pokusem přinést něco inovativního. To je ale také vším, čím tato hra je - pokusem. Díky nízké ceně je dostupná všem, otázkou ale samozřejmě je, jestli vás bude bavit ji hrát neustále dokola a zkoušet nové postupy.

29705014.review:
Enredo
Em The Deed você controla Arran Bruce, um rapaz que possui relacionamento tenso com sua familia e está prestes a ser deserdado pelo pai, este que deixara toda sua herança para a irmã louca de Bruce, ele não gostou nada da ideia e agora pretende, durante a comemoração de ainversário de seu pai, matar sua irmã e incriminar um dos residentes da casa pelo crime.

Jogabilidade
O jogo possui quatro fases:
1 - Antes da janta você pode conversar com os moradores e coletar itens (armas e objetos que poderão ser usados para ajudar a incriminar alguém. O dialogo irá influenciar a ultima fase
2 - A janta em si, aqui o dialogo, como a fase anterior, irão influenciar a ultima fase.
3 - O assasinato, aqui você você tem que plantar os itens nos diferentes comodos da casa para criar uma falsa evidencia cotra outra pessoa e, finalmente, usar uma arma (ou suas próprias mãos) para matar sua irmã e logo em seguida fugir na sala onde o crime ocorreu.
4 - Um investigador ira entrevistalo para saber mais sobre suas ações durante as outras fases, você deve escolher as respostas que criem uma história convincente para incriminar outra pessoa e remover as suspeitas que você possa ter.
No final, dependendo de suas respostas e das falsas evidências e você ou a pessoa que você tentou incriminar irão parar atras das grades destravando finais diferentes.

Opinião
Gostei muito do que vi, cada seção é diferente tentando incriminar outra pessoa com objetos diferentes e depois convencer o investigador de sua versão dos fatos, pelo preço valeu mais do que a pena.

29660477.review:
This game is really short but it has good replay value since there are multiple conversations you can have and there are multiple endings. I played through several times and I still haven't seen every conversation option or every way to use the evidence/weapons (I did complete all achievements). The story itself maybe isn't the greatest but the seemingly underlying reason for the feud between the siblings is interesting. The graphics are pretty nice for the type of game that this is. There are several objects around the house to interact with that give background on the family, with a couple of flashback memories thrown in which I thought was a nice touch. The game ran well other than having some kind of crash/error upon using the restart key; I forget what the error said. Even though it was annoying, it wasn't that hard to just run the game again. 

Overall, I thought the game was fun and interesting and had a lot of thought put into it, even though there is some logic missing. By that I mean, as an example, if you are caught at the bottom of the stairs it would be logical to think you had come running downstairs upon hearing something, or you just happened to be coming downstairs, rather than only thinking you had just come from the writing room, but that wasn't an option while talking to the inspector (at least I never saw it). You also can't two pieces of evidence, which could have been quite interesting. Still, I really enjoyed the game.

29636874.review:
It's a good game for a game which is made via RPG maker. One can play it if he has a one-hour free time with nothing to do. However, it's not the type of game I would say "You should play it" nor I would recommend the game to my friends. You don't have to play the game in a clever way, while at the beginning it says we should play it cleverly. Steam achievements are the only thing which makes you play the scenerio again and again. There's not enough item to be used as evidence and game doesn't provide you different options to plan a murder other than 4-5 pre-determined scenerios. The options are limited. 
I've written this just because the comments I've read before buying the game. These were like "Oh, it's a clever game which teaches how to get away with a murder.", "It's brilliant.", etc. Those comments were wrong. I just wanted to state that.

29255902.review:
This is a game that begs to be replayed, and its short length actually helps it in that regard. While there is clearly a limit to the combinations of weapons and evidence, there's nuances to how each combo might work best.

If nothing else, this game deserves to be played due to how unique it is. The music is perfectly atmospheric, and since a single playthrough is so short, it never becomes grating.

Speaking of atmosphere, there's something truly enjoyable about playing the bad guy in a game. It lets you indulge in some darker gameplay aspects than most games do.

 In early playthroughs, it becomes interesting to see how your perfect plan encounters problems, and the game is full of minor and pleasant surprises.

If you're interested in something that's far from the common fare here on Steam, you really can't go wrong with this one.

28803788.review:
The Deed is rather interesting RPG maker game. Where most games made in this engine are rather uninteresting this one I have to admit is rather interesting.

The Deed follows on Arran Bruce. He is traveling to his home for his abusive fathers birthday, but the is also travelling there with a sinister plan, to murder his sister who is stealing his fathers business after he dies.

The Deed has a very simple premise, once you arrive you have three tasks. Find how you're gonna kill your sister, get the tools and evidence to get away with it and do The Deed.

Once you arrive you case the mansion getting to know about your sister to find weaknesses such you can use against her. It's all very interesting and it's fun casing around to look for clues and tools to kill your sister. 

Now for some of the bad things:

The graphics and soundtrack are all very bland. I know a lot of these games are built with pre made assets and I get that some games are great, but it's still it's all very bland.

Grammar issues are present. Some words are misspelled and a few are mushed together example He is gonnakill her, stuff like that

The game is short. It takes 20 minutes to complete a single playthrough. But it has a lot of replay value. Multiple endings, multiple tools to kill your sister and you can blame people to get different endings. So you have at the very least 2 hours of content if you're planning on 100% the game.

Overall The Deed surprised me on how good it was. It's not the best RPG maker game I've seen, but it's not bad and for the price it's quite fun, so get it on sale and have yourself a good time.

Final Rating:
7/10

Pros:
+ Interesting Concept
+ Tons of replay value

Cons:
- Bland graphics and sound effects

28601425.review:
这是我最近玩过的拿RPG Maker做的最有趣的游戏，游戏中你要扮演一个童年不幸，和家里不和的富家子弟，杀掉自己的姐姐同时栽赃他人来让自己继承遗产。游戏分为谋杀前的准备，谋杀实施和谋杀后的警察审问三个阶段，其中栽赃陷害是这个游戏的核心乐趣所在。在准备阶段里要在和家人的互动中为栽赃做准备，比如激怒对方或是问出要栽赃的人的一些隐私作为他们犯罪的动机。在实施阶段中要将合适的道具放在正确的房间制造被栽赃人的动机证据，同时选用和被栽赃人有关的物品作为凶器来强化对警方的误导，最后在犯罪成功后还要逃到合适的房间。在审问阶段中，因为警察的问题会根据你之前的行动而变化，所以要记清楚你之前做过什么事，并给一个合理的答案，顺便将话题引导到对被栽赃人不利的方向。不看攻略的话，想要成功栽赃别人需要反复尝试才行，一般来说一周目是通过和所有家人的对话以及调查房间得知游戏中各个NPC的情况，比如父亲是个脾气暴躁的人，母亲对神经病女儿已经感到疲惫等等，然后利用这些信息想好要利用哪个NPC，在二周目以后就可以尝试栽赃了。
PS：栽赃全结局比较难打，可以参考社区的全成就攻略。

26747406.review:
Jednym zdaniem: The Deed to portret rodzinny we wnętrzu z ogromnym spadkiem i morderstwem w tle. Mała gra, którą można skończyć łatwo w kwadrans, ale... którą chce się przechodzić wielokrotnie na różne sposoby... nawet kilkanaście razy. W skrócie - perelka o wielkiej grywalności. :)

Plusy:

+ dobry pomysł - jak popełnić zabójstwo i uciec od odpowiedzialności (wrabiając w to innych) 
+ kreatywne wykorzystanie silnika RPG Maker
+ fajna fabuła jak na tak krótką grę (wzorowy scenariusz rodzinnego kryminału)
+ 5 postaci w grze (plus TY - a każdy może zostać osadzony za morderstwo siostry)
+ ciekawe retrospekcje z przeszłości rodziny
+ dobrze zbudowany background postaci
+ charakterystyczne postaci z własnymi mocno zarysowanymi charakterami
+ siostra jest tak zepsuta, że własnoręcznie chce się ją udusić ;)
+ gra zmusza do myślenia (jak kogoś wrobić? jakie informacje podsunąć policji? jaki dowód wykorzystać i gdzie go właściwie schować? jak odsunać od siebie podejrzenia?)
+ różne sposoby na morderstwo
+ gra ma aż 7 zakończeń
+ niska cena (prawie za darmo)

Minusy:

- brak fajnego intro
- brzydkie menu główne
- taka sobie grafika
- problem z odpaleniem gry na pełnym ekranie (rozwiązaniem opcja Alt + Enter)
- niektóre postacie mogłyby mieć bardziej trafne awatary
- brak głosów audio u postaci
- interfejs mółby być trochę bardziej doprecyzowany (jak szybko przeklikujemy znane już nam teksty, to łatwo wkliknąć w niewłaściwy wybór, którego nie chcemy wybrać) 
- zdarzają się małe bugi
- zakończenia mogłyby być bardziej atrakcyjne audiowizualnie

Podsumowanie: 

The Deed jest pomysłową produkcją i kolejnym po To The Moon i Bird Story znakomitym przykładem gry opartej o dość prosty silnik RPG Maker. Oby takich gier powstawało więcej. The Deed polecam fanom gier detektywistycznych i kryminalnych, a także tym graczom, którzy uwielbiają uruchamiać mózg podczas gry. Bo wcale nie jest tak łatwo kogoś wrobić po naszej myśli. ;) Wreszcie polecam graczom pamiętającym gry z czasów lat 90, gdzie grywalność była ważniejsza niż grafika.
Odradzam jedynie graczom, którzy szukają liniowych historii oraz atrakcyjnej grafiki, a także technicznego dopracowania, bo tych rzeczy The Deed nie ma.

Rada 1: 

Nie lubisz swojej siostry? To The Deed moze być grą dla Ciebie, gdyż tu jako brat możesz zrobić z nią porządek na wiele sposobów. ;)

Rada 2: 

Gra normalnie odpala się w irytującym okienku, ale.., jest prosty sposób na to, żeby odpalić ją na pełnym ekranie. Po prostu będąc w grze naciśnijcie kombinację klawiszy Alt + Enter. Enjoy. :)

26730124.review:
Clue Solitaire.

A simple, short whodunnit game where youdunnit, The Deed would probably work better as some kind of casual mobile game if it didn't require so much clicking through dialogue boxes. Completing the entire scenario once only takes around 10 minutes, brief enough that I got 100% completion in two hours despite screwing up a few rounds. This game's strength is mainly in its replayability, as the brevity of the scenario allows it to have nearly every decision you can make influence which ending you wind up with.

It's a cheap buy, the game and it's sequel together only costing around $3, so it's a sufficiently engaging reverse-murder mystery to pass the time.

26720863.review:
The Deed, primeiramente, é indicado para aqueles que curtem games de 2D/gênero de RPG Maker misturado com um suspense policial. Consiste então, em você armar  um assassinato para a sua irmã, herdeira da fortuna da família, sendo que você era o principal indicado para o cargo, mas por certos motivos, deserdaram você.
A fatídica noite se passa no aniversário de seu pai, e uma vez você completado o seu assassinato perfeito, a família é interrogada por um inspetor.

Indico, primeiro, por ser bem feito. E além do mais, é bastante curioso, dando um gosto de quero mais, já que o player pode interagir com praticamente tudo do cenário, e assim, planejar a sua cena do crime para sair ou não ileso disso.
Não o achei tão simples o quanto possa parecer, demorei um pouco a completar as 17 conquistas pedidas (até a data). E abre margem para maiores possibilidades além do óbvio, pois a sua fala e a das pessoas no local vão muito em conta, inclusive o seu humor, já que é claro no jogo que ninguém na família se dá bem, então motivo para matar, não falta na sua família. Além de tudo, os empregados, são a única coisa sociável e gentil na casa, mas ainda são peças para uma cena bem-feita.

Segundo, e mais profundo que isso, é o valor (talvez moral?) que Arran (o seu personagem) chega a ter como consequências de seus atos.

The Deed vale a pena ser explorado. Os vários finais que temos, juntamente com as conquistas, chegam a nos dar uma visão de cada lado do dado ou da moeda. Ganhei esse game de presente, e ao meu gosto, eu o amei. Valeu as horas gastas e a curiosidade que temos assim que descobrimos como o jogo brinca conosco e como tudo se desenrola. É um dos jogos que quebra a questão de que para um jogo ser ótimo, tem que ter gráfico.

Recomendo muito, para aqueles que gostam do gênero aqui proposto, e ainda mais, para aqueles que pouco têm contato com jogos assim, a experiência é ótima.

26720700.review: A idéia é boa mas o jogo é ruim, é curto, não vi lógica alguma e pelo visto sou um péssimo assassino, mesmo por esse preço não sei se vale a pena ou não

26683336.review:
Вы верите, что купленная за 10 рублей игра сможет заставить пройти себя свыше 20 раз?! Столь удачные примеры вселяют надежды в перспективы разработчиков-одиночек с нулевым бюджетом. И пусть описание в Steam не сбивает вас с толку - RPG-элементов тут нет, даром что игра сделана в конструкторе RPG Maker. 

Всё действо разворачивается, как в Настоящем Детективе, ночью и в дождь. Шотландия, сентябрь 1945-й года. Главный герой (ГГ) приезжает издалека на юбилей отца, влекомый не столько сильными сыновьими чувствами, сколько опасением за собственную долю в наследстве. Прошёл слух, что имущество родителей будет переписано на полоумную сестру ГГ и единственный видимый выход из ситуации - устранение соперницы.

Несмотря на однозначную преступность Поступка ("Deed") ГГ, наша жертва сочувствия совсем не вызывает, как, впрочем, и отец и даже служанка. Читали "Девушку с татуировкой дракона"? Здесь чувствуется такая же атмосфера аристократического семейства, пронизывающая холодом и давящая грузом старых обид, о которых лучше бы и не знать вообще. 

С нашего появления на пороге начинается летопись событий, где, как в "Пункте назначения" или "Эффекте бабочки" каждое слово, каждое решение влияет на концовку. И хотя весь мир представляет собой двухэтажный особняк (плюс подвал) из нескольких комнат с десятком предметов и шестью персонажами, комбинации этих самых предметов, а также диалоговых реплик дают каждый раз неожиданный ход событий.

Вроде бы всё повторяется по одной и той же схеме: приезд - поиск оружия и улик - ужин - подкидывание улик - убийство - допрос, а складывается по-разному, и честно говоря не самым-то лучшим образом... [spoiler] Например, мне так и не удалось упечь отца за решётку, чтобы получить наследство - всё время или ГГ туда отправляется, или отец остаётся на воле и переписывает имущество на организации [/spoiler]

Замечательное развлечение на несколько часов (я вон уже на 4 застрял, хотя ещё меньше половины достижений получил) для:
- любителей квестов, особенно детективных
- начинающих разработчиков - чтобы воочию убедиться, как из говна и веток RPG Maker'а выходят крутые самобытные проекты
- всех, кто любит хорошие нелинейные истории.

26317559.review:
某天下午，因为早上玩了会儿RPGMaker制作的游戏，STEAM游戏探索推荐列表里全部都是RPGMaker的作品，稍微翻了一下，基本都是些线性剧情+成型的战斗系统，可以说是毫无新意。而某些在剧情上稍微埋了点伏笔，原创音乐有点诚意，加入了某个原创的战斗系统的都被誉为“好作品”，可以说我对此类游戏完全处于审美疲劳的状态。
正当我想着随手翻完剩下几个游戏之后去赶其他大作的进度时，《The Deed》出现在了我的眼前。可以这么说，由于美工偷懒封面单调，以及不是特别多的销售量让我第一眼觉得这依然是一款烂大街的，无论是从开发成本还是给人带来的精神享受都很廉价的游戏。
但当我定睛去看游戏机制简介以及演示视频时，便立即被他吸引了，由于其亲民的价格（4元），我立即（在没有打折的情况下）将他购买入了库。事实证明，这款游戏确实是RPGMaker之中的一股清流。

[h1]>剧情叙述：7.3/10	[/h1]
游戏中，玩家扮演一位童年不幸的富家子弟艾伦·布鲁斯，Dunshiel庄园的合法继承人，在得知父亲没打算将财产留给他后，回到了阔别已久的家中，准备与疏远的家人做个了结：在父亲50岁生日那天回家杀死他的神经病妹妹从而获取继承权。
游戏没有使用大段的枯燥的背景故事文字让玩家阅读，而是通过和家人的对话以及对家中物品的调查中从边边角角构建一个立体的背景，增强了代入感。虽然每个周目流程很短，但剧情丰满，利用对话介绍了各个人物的背景，隐藏的秘密。

[h1]>核心玩法：8.0/10	[/h1]
这款游戏的核心就是杀人栽赃。游戏过程大体可以分为三个阶段：谋杀前构思整个栽赃，与家人谈话，选择凶器以及地点，与家人晚餐。进行谋杀并在尸体被发现前逃跑到合适的房间。以及警察到来之后的诡辩栽赃。
你需要尽你一切所能，将一切证据口供都指向你要栽赃的人，可以是父亲、母亲、管家、女仆、妹妹（自杀）等任何一个家庭成员，也可以不了了之。
虽然警长断案不能算很严谨，但要想栽赃成功，不能只靠选择别人的物品来充当凶器，布置好凶杀现场，将凶器藏到合适的地方，还需要你谨慎的选择谋杀之前任何时候的任何一句话，将对话往向你的栽赃对象不利的一面发展（尝试激怒他并令他说一些不合时宜的话），并且尽量少的提到遗产问题来掩盖杀人动机。很多时候一个你觉得无伤大雅的荤段子很有可能成为最后招来警察怀疑事迹败露的关键。
由于场景很多并且你可以栽赃给任何一个人，而每个人的性格弱点和能够栽赃的杀人动机以及具体思路都不一样，玩家可以通过多周目来击破每个人。所以这款游戏的可玩性非常之高。

[h1]>贴图音乐：6.0/10	[/h1]

这两者没有什么特别出众的地方所以放在一起说，贴图至少没有像某些游戏一样完全使用RM自带素材进行制作。而BGM并不是这款游戏的加分点，中规中矩，只停留在能够营造想要营造的紧张气氛的层面。

[h1]>总评：7.1/10	[/h1]
总之，当第一眼看到这款游戏的机制时，便惊叹于它不同于目前其他RPG“探险”的核心。非常具有创意，强力推荐。

26193902.review:
The Deed is a fun, short little game. It doesn't promise too much, and what it does promise it delivers quite well.

I didn't replay it completely to get every ending, but I did get several endings, and I like the effort put into the various possibilities.

What I appreciate the most--what prompted me to post this review--is the writing. Nothing award-winning, but compared with so many other indie RPGs, VNs, and gamebooks I've read and played lately, the writing here is refreshingly good. The characters don't go far beyond mere sketches, but that's okay for a modest tale such as this. The dialogue is natural, and the bleakly hostile relationships are well expressed; so too is the overall grim and creepy mood. And the writing doesn't have many technical problems (grammar, spelling, punctuation), another thing that puts it a tier above so many other little indies.

For that, it deserves a recommendation.

26156790.review:
I clicked a thumbs up because I think the author tried their best most likely, and I had fun streaming this game on Twitch and hanging out with my friends while I played it. There are also two mustache characters (the dev should add a dating system so I can date George). 

So since I enjoyed my time with the game, I decided to pick "Yes." But this is a heavily flawed game. I feel many people could feel like even their $1 was wasted on this game, so please read the review if you might want to use your money on another game.

The concept behind the game is quite clever. Basically, the core of the gameplay revolves around making dialogue choices to uncover things about characters you can use to frame them, as well as choosing two items to use in your deed (generally, an 'evidence' item to plant, and a weapon, though you can choose two evidences or two weapons if you want).

With many conversation paths and all of the various combinations of evidence, rooms to plant evidence, and weapons to use, there are a lot of different ways the game seemingly can unfold. The main entertainment in the game is from playing repeatedly (the game is only 20 minutes long or so the first couple of times, and you can go as fast as 5 minutes on successive runs if you're not bothering to read all the text you already read before)

But this is where the first real problem with the game arises. You don't have to be perfect and make every "right" choice in order to frame someone, which is good, since there are tons of possible combinations of things to say and item usages. But what's very disappointing is that the solutions are so obvious and loose to success that you once you frame one person, you can pretty much follow the same 'formula' to frame anyone just as easily. There's almost no variety in the solutions, and everything is so obvious you'd have to purposely try to fail. I got an "unsolved" case my first game because I was just experimenting with the systems and choosing whatever, but after that I solved everyone on my first try without any effort.

Which items are connected to which character are so obvious you don't even need to talk to the characters to guess who it should be linked to. Your dad's shotgun is obviously linked to your dad. Your mom's diary is obviously about your mom. The descriptions of the items will usually just tell you almost directly who it will help frame.

The conversation paths are pretty much the same. Basically just make sure you talk to the person you're wanting to frame, and they'll just reveal something you can abuse as a motive and you're done. There are like one or two cases where you'll have to be careful about what you pick or actually talk to more than one person. But that's rare. You generally will have the option of being extremely rude to the person which will make them not talk to you, or doing literally anything else which will have them reveal a motive for you.

As for evidence dropping, it seemed to me as long as you dropped the evidence in a certain room, it would always point to the person you're wanting to frame. For every character in the game except one, I dropped the evidence in that room and it worked perfectly.

By the end of the game, I was starting to become convinced you could use any weapon you wanted and still frame whoever you wanted, too. The solutions seemed loose enough for that. I think you could even shoot her in the back with a shotgun and get it ruled a suicide.

But if you somehow don't realize the best solution right away, you could play through a few times and still be curious about how to frame someone. Plus, you have a lot of dialogue options to play with, so you can at least try a few different branches to see what they say.

But that's the biggest problem with the game -- the writing is abysmal. And I don't just mean the fact that it obviously was not proofread. But the author is definitely an amateur. Expect the story quality to be on par with something like the Jeff the Killer creepypasta.

There's a ton of awkwardness that arises from the story not being thought through well or proofread by another person, from the character knocking on the door to the house when he is expected and the butler is already escorting him, to being able to kill someone with a few whacks with a lightweight broomstick, without them causing any kind of struggle or reaction.

Most of the story revolves around getting to know the characters and the aspects of them you use to frame them. And almost none of the murder motives make any sense. And the conversations all feel a bit rushed and unnatural. Everyone's motive seems to boil down to one character trait about them. "He has a temper, so obviuosly he would kill someone." That kind of thing. Sometimes the "character flaw" you're exposing doesn't even make sense as a murder motive. "He sexually harasses women" is not a murder motive. "She's a lesbian" is not a murder motive.

Even the main character who really is the killer -- I don't really understand why he wants to kill his sister. He hates his family and left them to start his own independent life, where he was apparently doing just fine. But now he decides he is going to go through the trouble of killing his own sister and framing someone for it so that he can get an inheritence... of a family name and property and business that he hates and wants to have no part in?

But by far the worst part about the writing is that the story attempts to cover a lot of serious themes -- mental illness, suicide, child abuse, sexual harassment, murder motive, etc. -- but the author clearly doesn't know much about these things and did not research any of these topics and handles them all completely inappropriately and unrealistically. These topics are portrayed with ignorance and shallowness. 

The portrayal of a person suffering from mental illness amounts to pretty much how a small child would describe a "crazy person." I realize that in the 1940s, mental health issues were not commonly understood at all, and doctors did indeed just diagnose "insanity." It would make sense for the characters to talk about mental illness in an ignorant way -- but a character who is supposed to actually suffer from a mental illness should, well, actually be written like a person with a real mental health issue, even if it's not understood by the characters themselves. I feel like the author doesn't understand mental illness any more than a 1940s doctor would.

Pretty much every serious topic in the game is handled in the same manner. The game is clearly meant to be taken seriously, and it is story-driven, so the story needs to be well-researched, proofread, and developed, but it sorely fails in this area. If I hadn't been playing while talking to everyone on twitch and being able to talk and laugh about it, I may have been extremely frustrated with the poor writing. Instead, my friends and I have some new in-jokes based on some of the ridiculousness (poison turns you green, cunning pixie, etc.)

If you're wanting an interesting or intriguing story, or gameplay that requires a lot of tough decision making to solve (or rather, commit!) a murder, don't waste your dollar. Stay far away from this game. 

If you're wanting to see a clever idea despite its clunky execution and don't mind that the solutions will be too obvious and the writing may as well contain a Sonic the Hedgehog self-insert OC, go ahead and try it. I had fun for 4 hours with it.

Although the game was marred by severe game-wide flaws, I appreciated the idea behind the game and what it was going for, enjoyed the mustaches, had some laughs, and even felt a bit inspired by the concept of the whole thing. Maybe I'll try to make a game with a similar type of concept some day. All of that is worth a dollar. I got this as a gift for my birthday, though, and so I definitely can't complain. It was a good gift.

26120618.review:
The Deed is a very short RPG game (completed within about 20-30 minutes if you read everything, 10 if you just click) where you have to murder your sister at a dinner party and not get caught. You have to pick up two items, one evidence item and one weapon. Or, you could plant two evidence items and use your bare hands to kill her. 

Was the game worth the $0.60? YES. Would you say it is worth more? Yes, but not much due to its length. However, you can play it over and over again and as you do, you realize that the story behind the game is actually quite detailed. It's amazing how the creators of this game managed to portray every character's personality so well in the short amount of time the game takes to play. 

An interesting thing in this game is the fact that you get to see some flashbacks from your past when you look at/interact with certain items, such as the mirror in the hallway and the chair in your parents' room. It's a nice touch and it really helps you get a sense of what the main character went through as a child and why he has his mind set on killing his sister.

And on to the best part: the weapons! Although this game takes place inside a house and runs a very short time, there are a great deal of weapons and things to choose from, such as but not limited to, a pool cue, a broom handle, a broken mirror, a shotgun and even a fencing sword! The variety in this game is phenominal and you can tell just by looking at it how much love and effort went into creating it - the atmosphere, the characters and everything.

Overall, if I was to give this game a rating out of 10, 1 being terrible and 10 being absolutely groundbreaking - I'd give this game a 7/10 for being a good, simple, and creative way to spend 20 minutes and $0.60. If you have a love for murder mysteries and the like, I highly recommend this game. Seriously, it's so cheap and so much fun, you'd be a fool not to buy it.
